name: Colonel's Retreat

reviews.text: Good value, for Delhi, guest house in Defence Colony. This is however a guest house, so don't expect all the services of a hotel.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in Delhi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely, large, immaculately clean rooms, with satellite TV, aircon and a fridge. Each floor has a large comfortable sitting room shared between three or four bedrooms, complete with leather sofas and ultrafast free broadband. There is also a dining table for breakfast and if you ask in advance for an evening meal. Evening meals are good but not outstanding.
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable and friendly in a convenient location.

reviews.text: Very close to good restaurants at Defence Colony market.
reviews.title: For a quiet, friendly, professional stay.....a home away from home.

reviews.text: Friendly and very efficient staff.
reviews.title: An absolute joy!

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed for 8 days and enjoyed every minute. The rooms are comfortable, clean and serviced daily. The staff are so willing to help with any request. The food is excellent. Located within 5 mins walk of a Metro station in a very safe area.
reviews.title: The perfect place for the perfect time

reviews.text: Our family stayed at Colonel's Retreat 6 six days during our vacation to India in winter 2009 (including two children under 10) and really enjoyed our stay. The staff are really friendly, the cook is great, the location is fantastic and the owner, Arun, was very responsive and attentive. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. Overall great value for money. This was our best B&B experience (of 5 over the past 3 years). We highly recommend it as a great and reasonably priced stay in Delhi. I plan to stay there even for my business trips in future!
reviews.title: Fantastic place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a guest house "value for the money" - hospitality, clean linen, clean room and bathroom, internet, breakfast, AC - all minimum you need to spend nights while being out during the day.
reviews.title: SImple and clean guest house

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: During our India-trip this summer, we were at this b&b for 2 nights (1 in July - 1 in August) - it's an excellent place to stay where you get good value for your money.
reviews.title: Don't hesitate, just book this nice place ...

reviews.text: Staff is very helpful, nice and friendly.
reviews.title: Very homely & friendly place

reviews.text: Place is very clean, rooms are comfortable, with good A/C and fan.
reviews.title: excelent in delhi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Colonel's Retreat. The spotless conditions and welcoming rooms, the friendly and helpful staff, and Arun who ensures that your stay is absolutely comfortable, in such an understated way, ensure that you can retreat to calm after the craziness that can be life in India....oh, and the great breakfasts!
reviews.title: A Delightful Retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A comfortable place in a quiet neighborhood - ignore the stinking open sewer 50 yards from the hotel. The rooms (we stayed in 2 different rooms) are on the small size but you do get a tub and shower that works and the all-important wall-mounted flat screen TV. The weird thing about this hotel is the customer service. There's no lobby so if you need something you have to track one of the staff down. And they can be hard to find outside of meal times. The guest lounge/dining room is on the third floor; that's where to look for the staff.
reviews.title: If you absolutely must have a completely western bathroom in India this is the place to stay.

reviews.text: I stayed at Colonel's retreat 5 days with my wife and my 5 years old son. We really enjoyed our stay there. The guest house has 2 branches, each has 5/6 rooms. Rooms are simple but furniture is in very good condition. Bathrooms are marbled. Here are the good and few bad sides I found :
reviews.title: Very elegant guest house... with only a few defects

reviews.text: Good points :
reviews.title: Quiet Retreat in South Delhi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - very quiet residential area (incredibly silent, especially at night), located 10 minutes walk from Defence Colony market (good restaurants and shops)
reviews.title: Pleasant, friendly B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Colonel's Retreat is clean and in a good location. The stay seemed more like a long-term apartment stay than a B&B. The staff is polite and cordial but a bit distant and cold. I would recommend this place and the food as an alternative to the high-end hotels.
reviews.title: More like a long-term apartment stay than B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The biggest advantage of this upmarket B&B is its calm and quiet South Delhi location in the affluent suburb of Defence Colony - handy for the airport and the sights of Humayun's Tomb, Qutb Minar and the Baha'i Temple as well as someupmarket shopping precincts.
reviews.title: An oasis of calm - at a price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As first time India visitors, we wanted somewhere without imminent culture shock and booked a twin room. We arrived in the early morning after a much delayed flight to a warm welcome of Nescafe and freshly cooked breakfast. Our room, although facing the street, was quiet and nicely decorated. although rather on the small side with more than adventurous electrics and a coating of dust here and there. Beds were extremely small and hard yet fairly comfortable - and it was nice and quiet at night, a rare thing in Delhi. Breakfast, served in the living room our room went out to, was quite nice but the Indian tourist hotel fare of eggs and toast - and instant coffee.
reviews.title: A nice accomodation

reviews.text: You'll share the communal areas with quiet and respectable business people working for ethical or fairtrade enterprises so be prepared for a lot of worthy talk over breakfast. There is a well-functioning computer with reliable Internet in the living room as well.
reviews.title: clean green and pristine

reviews.text: We met the friendly and well-travelled owner one morning who gave us lots of useful advice on where to visit and wasn't pushing the hotel's tours at all. You can catch an auto-rickshaw in front of the building and the hotel will organise taxis at a fair price for you. Only five minutes walk away is the Defence Colony market which is not so good for shopping but has great restaurants. There is a Metro station not too far away, but by car or auto-rickshaw it takes nearly an hour to get to Old/New Delhi train stations.
reviews.title: Excellent experience

description: A great favorite with business travelers and overseas tourists alike, offering a truly comfortable, elegant place to stay. Colonel’s Retreat has been lovingly created by people who are frequent global travelers themselves and who take pride in maintaining the highest world-class standards of hospitality. All rooms are air-conditioned rooms with cable TV, refrigerator, free wi-fi, electronic safe. Attached baths, with hot and cold running water.Soon a spa , massage and sauna.
